inclusion.criterion: 6-30 years old TSC patients (by Gomez criteria)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: more than 8 seizures occurred in the 4-week baseline time, with no continued seizure-free time of more than 10 days a month
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: more than two antiepileptic drugs (AED) had been administered but fail to control the situation; maintaining with 1 or more than 1 AEDS for over 2 months and intending to continue with the drugs
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: patients who had been treated with rapamycin should have been stopped for more than 3 months
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: vagus nerve stimulation (VNS) is allowed as a previous or current therapy and would maintain until the end of the trial
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Subependymal Giant Cell Astrocytoma and requires immediate surgery;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: a history of intracranial surgery within 6 months;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: epilepsy caused by improper use of drugs;
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: patients treated with aspirin had severe or intolerant side effects, including gastrointestinal ulcer, bleeding, aspirin allergy, and other conditions;
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy. He has had multiple seizures and is currently on medication. However, he has also been treated with rapamycin in the past, which may be an exclusion criterion.
